summary: The Veterans Appeals Efficiency Act of 2025 aims to improve the efficiency of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in adjudicating and appealing veterans' claims. Key provisions include requiring annual reports on adjudication and appeal timelines, establishing guidelines for advancing cases, mandating tracking of certain claims, and granting the Board of Veterans' Appeals (BVA) authority to aggregate appeals involving common questions. The bill also expands the jurisdiction of the Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims and mandates studies and assessments aimed at improving the appeals process. The overall goal is to streamline the handling of veterans' claims.
